Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2009 04:02PM Positivity wrote: Thank you for your support ladies. It is so nice to be able to talk to people who have been through it themselves or with a loved one. I felt alone until I found the forum. I don't like talking to my husband about it because I don't like to worry him. I will definitely be aggressive about it. A part of me wants to just hear "we saw nothing and all is well" and just walk away, but the fact is that this dimple which wasn't there before is there and when I lift my arms over my head it does retract (I can't believe I'm even writing this - I'm so scared); and so I need to be aggressive as you all say I need to be with it and not take no for an answer. I guess these are times when they say you need a 2nd, 3rd, and even a 4th opinion. Thanks again ladies...my prayers are also with you and your loved ones!
Posts.Title: Breast Dimpling Positivity Positivity

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2009 11:37AM Positivity wrote: Hello ladies, I finally got my mammo results and they are also negative. I will not be happy until I see the specialist though. I have an appointment with my GP next Teusday and will be asking for the referral. I need to clear all my basis. I am trying to be happy with the results I got but seems deep down inside anxiety is still there, since the symptoms are there. The indenting seems to be extending to the areola. So I am not giving up my quest to be 100% positive all is well.
Posts.Title: Breast Dimpling Positivity Positivity

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2009 10:24AM Positivity wrote: Hello All, You are all so supportive and in just two days have become my support group. Last night I was staring at the site in the mirror and noticed that the dimpling has extended more towards the areola region. This can not be good. I thought it was just me so asked my husband to look, and he says he also sees it. I can not wait until these results are in now. I wish they would do a skin patch biopsy NOW, along with an MRI. I am really trying to stay positive and not let the demons in my head take the best of me, but it is so hard this time...Its like my head is speaking to me in a language I don't even understand.
Posts.Title: Breast Dimpling Positivity Positivity

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2009 11:14AM Positivity wrote: The day I went in they said in the diagnostic lab that there are 2 radiologists, one was on holiday and the other would be in on Thursday (tomorrow), so that's why I had to wait. I work in a chronic pain clinic so the doctor I work with ordered the tests when I experessed concerns and he checked my R breast. When I get the results I will be here, and will probably read the report myself too. The doctor here says he will call in on Friday to see if they can tell him the results over the phone. Either way I will ask for further testing i.e. biopsy and MRI. I have become such a basket case - I am normally very upbeat and energetic and so it shows all over my face and body language when worried like this and consumed in thought. As I mentioned before I am hiding this from my family so have avoided going to see them, which makes me feel even more vulnrable.  I am also wondering of alternative medicine treatments - there's a lot on the internet that can overwhelm a person in my position, any thoughts of complimentary or alternative meds or treatments?

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2009 11:20AM Positivity wrote: Thank you so much for your continuous support and positive attitude. I wish you a great weekend too.

Posts.Content: Positivity wrote: I am 31, recently married (September 2008), without any full term pregnancies as of yet, and have recently noticed a dimpling in the lower portion of my right breast. I performed a mammogram and ultrasound yesterday, and am in the dreadful process of waiting for the results, which they said would be in in a week. I am so terrified. I am trying not to be for my husband, and am hiding it from my parents (I am an only child). But I can't help it, I am terrified... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast Dimpling Positivity Positivity

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2009 01:28PM Positivity wrote: Hello all,  I have my ultrasound report back and it is a negative report, bilateral breasts were unremarkable. I am still waiting to hear the results of the mammogram. I have however decided, thanks to all of your input and advice, that regardless of the mammogram and ultrasound results I will go to see a breast cancer specialist in one of our local hospitals. I will be getting that referral sometime next week. The thing is there is indentation, and I really need to know why, and what it is exactly.
Posts.Title: Breast Dimpling Positivity Positivity

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2009 04:24PM Positivity wrote: Thank you all for so much support. I needed to vent and what better place then this. I think a breast MRI is a good idea, this is now two people suggesting it and sharing with me that's how they got their answers. I am going to request that. For the most part, I have been healthy all my life. I've had two fractured wrists, and a fractured knee. I have osteopenia (though they thought I'd be two young for that too), but not much else. I live in Canada and because of our health system things are extra slow here, but I work as part of a medical team and will ask for things to be done urgently. I think for me the waiting and not knowing is just horrible.
